alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 4:01PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Hocking and southern Fairfield Counties in Ohio * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 PM EST, Radar indicated prolonged moderate rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Lancaster, Logan, Nelsonville, Bremen, Murray City, Sugar Grove, Enterprise, Rockbridge, Gibisonville, Ilesboro, Union Furnace, South Bloomingville, Haydenville and Clearport.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
